p: Most patients considered that the care from medical staff during hospitalization was the most important supportive factor, indicating that they provided a sense of security. A number of patients developed a reliance on these behaviors. P14: "Doctors and nurses treat me very well and care about me, I am really touched, I can't live without them (crying)." P5: "It feels good and I have peace of mind when I see them." P7: "In fact, my condition is stable, but I always expect the doctors and nurses to look at me more and talk to me more."
